Title.evidence: Purpose: The study aimed to assess pharmacokinetics and safety of two oxycodone/naloxone prolonged-release tablet formulations in the Chinese population.

Trial_Design.evidence: randomized, open-label, two-period crossover clinical trial.

Participants.evidence: The study was conducted in 36 Chinese patients with chronic pain in both fasting and fed states.

Objective.evidence: The study aimed to assess pharmacokinetics and safety of two oxycodone/naloxone prolonged-release tablet formulations in the Chinese population.

Method_Outcome.evidence: No serious adverse events were reported.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The study was conducted in 36 Chinese patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: the mean (± standard deviation, SD) peak concentration (C max ), area under concentration–time curve from time 0 to the last measurable concentration (AUC 0–t ) and to infinite time (AUC 0–∞ ), and elimination half-life (t 1/2 ) of oxycodone for the brand-name and generic formulations were 50.9 ± 10.9 and 52.1 ± 9.58 ng/mL, 577 ± 148 and 554 ± 104 h*ng/mL, 579 ± 150 and 556 ± 104 h*ng/mL, and 5.17 ± 0.834 and 5.10 ± 0.877 h, respectively.

Harms.evidence: No serious adverse events were reported.
